result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Allen Pettis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith Allen Pettis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Keith Allen Pettis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference to follow 21CF3347 currently set for a jury trial on November 7, 2022.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Keith Allen Pettis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  This matter will tag along 21CF3347 and 22CF2430 (currently set for trial).  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court by video with Attorney Connor Romenesko who appears in person.  Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 22CF2430. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Kehoss. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LMP or 2500 block of W. Kibourn Ave, Milwaukee, WI

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES, THIS HEARING WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD: 
Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Keith Allen Pettis in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keith Allen Pettis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
